cleaned_text: Role of Ayurveda and Yoga-Based lifestyle in the COVID-19 pandemic - A narrative review - PMID: 34305355 - PMCID: [PMC8286865](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/pmc8286865/) - DOI: [10.1016/j.jaim.2021.07.009](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jaim.2021.07.009) Role of Ayurveda and Yoga-Based lifestyle in the COVID-19 pandemic - A narrative review Abstract The COVID-19 pandemic has posed an immense challenge to health care systems around the globe in terms of limited health care facilities and proven medical therapeutics to address the symptoms of the infection. The current health care strategies are primarily focused on either the pathogen or the environmental factors. However, efforts towards strengthening the host immunity are important from public health perspective to prevent the spread of infection and downregulate the potency of the infectious agent. While a vaccine can induce specific immunity in the host, non-specific ways of improving overall host immunity are needed as well. This scenario has paved the way for the use of traditional Indian therapies such as Ayurveda and Yoga. This review aims at collating available evidence on Ayurveda, Yoga, and COVID-19.
